snippet: There is such a surplus of Ph.D.s that in the most popular fields, like biomedicine, fewer than one in six reach their goal in academia....
abstract: The Upshot; less than half of those who have earned doctorates in science or engineering work in academic positions that are directly related to what they have trained for due to surplus of PhDs; experience of Emmanuelle Charpentier, who spent 25 years shuffling through academic institutions before making momentous gene editing discovery and securing top post, reveals how even most brilliant research scientists can struggle.
lead_paragraph: There is such a surplus of Ph.D.s that in the most popular fields, like biomedicine, fewer than one in six reach their goal in academia.

headline.print_headline: So Many Research Scientists, So Few Professorships
headline.main: So Many Research Scientists, So Few Openings as Professors
